alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 7:19PM CDT until March 23 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 719 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Grove... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Spavinaw State Park... Cherokee State Park... Chloeta... Rose... Sportsmen Acres Community... Honey Creek State Park... Strang... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
